name: Residenza Canali ai Coronari

reviews.title: Great little place
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in Feb 2007 for 3 nights. We would reccommend the hotel arrange a taxi pick up for you as it is very tucked away. They send a good standard of private taxi.

reviews.title: Excellent find in a safe location for the 'Over 60 Club'!
reviews.text: This is a small hotel on a side street near Piazza Navona. Although near it it feels miles away. There is barely a name outside the hotel but once inside you find a 24 hour reception, English speaking staff and a small but very clean en suite bedroom. Our room had a little balcony. Not much of a view but perfect if you are there in Summer for a seat outside.

reviews.title: The Best Place to Stay In Rome
reviews.text: As mentioned previously there is no bar, lobby etc but if you want a quiet stay with no fuss it's perfect. Great breakfast to set you up for the day. Tea and coffee making in the bedroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked miles during our stay but this hotel is equidistant to a lot of sites and it is possible to call in during the day and continue elsewhere. We felt no need for public tansport.
reviews.title: Fantastic location..!!
Enjoyed Residenza Canali
reviews.text: It was no problem for us but the hotel has no lift so be prepared to climb stairs daily to you room.
This was our first visit to Rome with our 3 teenage children.
reviews.title: Terrific location

reviews.text: We had two interconnecting rooms, the kids room was very small and the beds not particularly comfortable. I would probably recommend with a family our size getting two separate rooms with a bathroom each.
reviews.title: Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was small with no lift but in a fabulous location. There was no street noise at all. We felt very safe here and the little cobbled street was full of antique shops and surrounded by great restaurants. We were able to walk everywhere easily.
reviews.title: Great hotel...our 2nd trip here

reviews.text: Breakfast was quite nice and the hotel service was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel in central Rome

likes.liked: — The perfect location and friendly staff

reviews.text: I am thrilled to get to tell you about our exceptional experience at the Residenza di Canali. First I will share that you cannot find a better, more informed, more attentive, more charming, happy, service and guest oriented staff! Stefano, a true celebrity from all the feedback on the internet, is a kind and old fashioned helpful inn keeper. He helped us with EVERYTHING and truly our stay in Rome would have been a catastrophe without his assistance (we encountered some real travel challenges as we arrived in Rome.) The place is immaculate! Room are not huge but always clean. We had a GREAT bathroom and a terrace (if you cannot climb 5 flights of stairs after a day of touring Rome, DON'T ask for the terrace room!) which looked out on the neighborhood rooftops. The intimacy of this beautiful villa is captivating. The food was great! Only drawback was our room was extremely hot. The AC was NOT good (they gave us a fan) but we opened the french doors to the terrace and pulled the bed over to the fresh air where we could watch the beautiful Roman sky. What you get at this small hotel is well priced and honestly, when Stefano walked us out to our waiting taxi as we said arrivedercii for the last time, I truly felt like I was leaving a friend. STEFANO, YOU ARE A STAR not just on Tripadvisor but in our hearts!
reviews.title: A real keeper
Perfect position!
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here in November and what a great find it was! Situated in a fabulous location right next to Piazza Navona you can wander through cobbled sidestreets to most of the major attractions. The hotel is really clean with very helpful staff and serves a really nice breakfast. They made every effort to assist in the booking of restaurants etc. and we would stay there again.
We stayed at this B&B for 3 nights. It is very conveniently located and we could walk everywhere. The only time we didn't walk was when we were tired and wanted to go to Trastevere one evening.
reviews.title: Can walk to all the sights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is adequate..usual sort of breakfast - cereal/croissant/cheese/juice. Staff were semi friendly. The rooms are small like everywhere in Europe. There is heating.
reviews.title: Great location and more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside is that there are stairs to climb to reach reception and the rooms, so if you have heavy luggage or have difficulty climbing then this probably isn't the best place for you.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had travelled from quite far and had asked for a pick up from the airport. I would definitely recommend this because on our own we would have found it tiresome after a long flght and difficult to find the B&B on our own since it is located in a small alley. The driver that picks you up in his mercedes doesn't know much English so knowing some Italian is useful!
reviews.title: Very kind, great location

reviews.text: We had a fine and comfortable stay there. Thought that 180 Euros cash was a bit pricey but then realised that for the location that's the price you have to pay in places like Rome/Venice.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We book the Hotel with a fantastic agency based in Italy, that has organized our trip to Rome. We are French and never been to Italy, this is was our first trip, and our agency, www.senseofitaly.com
reviews.title: Good Hotel.

reviews.text: organized for us a trip that was jus a dream... we spend a couple of nights at the hotel and we really enjoied...
reviews.title: Location, Location!
Great Location! Good price.
reviews.text: Marie & Pierre

reviews.title: great location
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised. Perhaps the best part of the Residenza Canali is the location. The place was set down a beautiful cobbled street which had mainly cute antique stores. We walked EVERYWHERE - Colosseo, The Vatican, Trevi Foutain...and the Pantheon and Navona Square are practically 2 seconds away! We were surprised at how walkable Rome was.
The rooms were nicely decorated and included great amenities (selection of coffee/tea, kettle, toiletries, hairdryer etc)
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location

reviews.text: Residenza Canali is perfectly situated, off of the prettiest street in Rome, Via Coronari. Being Rome, there is street noise, so make sure to close the windows and use the air-conditioner. We loved having easy access to all the major sights of historic Rome, plus the romantic ambience of the narrow cobble-stoned streets around Piazza Navona. Breakfast is lovely and generous.
reviews.title: Best location in all of Rome!

reviews.text: Afraid to say how great it was since next time I want to go there it will be all booked up. Except for the stairs it couldn't have been better. Staff was OUTSTANDING, and location great.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in mid-July. Let me first say that our room was perfectly cooled by the air conditioning during what was a record setting hot spell. Our room was on the third floor. Keep in mind that the reception desk is actually on the second floor.
reviews.title: You can believe all the great reviews! Location, charm and a great staff.

reviews.text: Looking at the other reviews it seems that it was one (?) of the top floor rooms with a terrace that seemed to be hot, so ask the staff (I feel certain they will guide you) when you book and avoid that room(s) until the AC is upgraded. Also, as I understand it (from reading the reviews of many different hotels) no matter what the temperature many hotels do not turn on their AC until a certain date arrives so ask ahead of time about that too.
reviews.title: Location,Location,location

reviews.text: We booked directly with the hotel and received a discount for paying cash at checkout. We also arranged transportation from the airport through them. This hotel is a little hard to find (which we also learned from the reviews) so booking transportation arranged through the hotel made our arrival simple and pleasant.
reviews.title: We will be back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Residenza Canali in early May after reading the impressive reviews on Tripadvisor. We were given a double room on the third (of four) floor. There is not a lift, so you must walk up a flight of stairs to get to the lobby, then more stairs to get to your room. This was not a problem for us, but it is something to consider for guests with mobility issues. We were very happy with the room, which was clean and full of character. The bathroom looked recently renovated, and while the shower was small for me, it was still sufficient. There is a computer in the lobby for guests, which I always look for when considering a hotel. Paolo, the owner, is a gracious host. He (or others who might be at the front desk) has many suggestions for dining or sightseeing, as well as transport to the airport. I was happy to be able to charge the car service to my room bill, as I would have had to take out more Euros otherwise. I am not a big breakfast person, so I found the offerings sufficient. The basics of cereal, rolls, ham, cheese, and yogurt were more than fine with me. The hotel is in my favorite area of Rome, the historic center, and is a very short walk to the Piazza Navona or the Pantheon, among other amazing sites. In closing, I was very happy with our choice of the Hotel Residenza Canali and would absolutely consider a return visit should we return to Rome.
reviews.title: An Exceptional Choice in an Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected the Canali based on the reviews we read here and elsewhere. The location is certainly excellent, but from there things kind of go downhill. First, they must have brought in an entirely new staff, because these folks -- with the sole exception of the fellow who checked us in (we never saw him again) -- were rather dour, not very eager to help, seemingly preoccupied, and not very helpful. We didn't ask for much, but it always felt as though we were imposing on them. They never seemed to smile or make you feel welcome. They mishandled a restaurant reservation by reserving for the wrong day, and never apologized or offered to rectify it in some way. Perhaps if they payed a little more attention to the guests... They did provide us with two good local restaurant recommendations (one is just around the corner). We spent 20 minutes at breakfast one morning listening to one of the staff loudly pontificating in Italian outside the breakfast room about God knows what without ever offering us a cappuccino. The breakfast was meh; the coffee was not good, and the cappucinos were disappointingly weak (they never offered a second cappuccino, either). The woman who seemed to be mostly in charge of the breakfast room looked as though she wanted to be anyplace else but there (that's pleasant). The croissants were more soggy than anything; definitely not good. The rolls are like mini-sandwhich buns from the supermarket. We've had other basic Italian hotel breakfasts that were considerably better. The breakfast room itself is dark and rather dingy. The rooms themselves are "ok"; they're reasonably large and comfortable, but quite plain. Our room also got a lot of noise from motorcycles and other street noise. Normally when I read negative reviews among many positive rating, I wonder whether the reviewer was at fault somehow. I take no pleasure in expressing my disappointment at out experience oat the Canali. This is just an honest description of our experience. Maybe we just got stuck with the Canali's "B" team, but it was a pretty sad performance. Of the dozen or so places we've stayed at in Italy, this was probably the most disappointing.
reviews.title: very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely firendly place, right in the middle of all that there is to see in the heart of ancient Rome. You can easily walk to almost everything.
reviews.title: A Gem in the Heart of Old Rome

reviews.text: The hotel itself is more like a guest house, with a family atmosphere and limited number of rooms. The staff are funny and helpful.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: We were welcomed at the airport by the pick up service, which seemed like a great luxury until we realised that the price was just 2 Euros more than the standard fixed taxi rate (if you can get that!)
reviews.title: Very Pleasant!

reviews.text: This hotel has a FANTASTIC location off a fairy-tale street in the heart of historic Rome -- within walking distance of most of Rome's major sites, plus great restaurants. It also has a wonderful, knowledgeable staff, a delicious complimentary breakfast, clean and comfortable rooms and the price is very reasonable. I won't even look at another hotel when I return to Rome -- my stay here was great! No complaints.
reviews.title: This hotel is a dream come true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although, not a fancy hotel or room, it was larger than expected. It seemed to be a recently refurbished room (especially the bathroom) and it was very conveniently located. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. I liked being right upstairs from a street with stores; it was very convenient. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is important to know that getting a hotel with "wow-factor" in Roma without emptying your wallet is almost impossible. We came to Rome after visiting several fantastic B&Bs/hotels in Sicily, so we were a bit spoilt. We chose Residenza ai Canali because of the location. When visiting Rome in 2011, we stayed in the same area and loved it. The service was also very good. When we had to call the hotel twice to rearrange our transport from the airport because our plane was delayed from Sicily, they helped us out. We had a superior double room with terrace. The terrace was very nice although we didn't use it because of rainy weather. The bathroom and the breakfast were also OK (don't expect too much from breakfasts in Rome). But the room was tiny and in the breakfast room the tables were situated so close that is was almost impossible to walk to and from the buffet. This room was our second most expensive hotel room in 2012 (out of 18 hotels). But NOT the second best! But this is Rome! Will we come back to Residenza ai Canali? Perhaps yes. Time will show. We will definitely come back to fantastic Rome very soon!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to rate this hotel higher but, until they improve their room booking, furnishings, and bedding, I have to give it an "average" rating. We stayed at this hotel primarily because of the location. We reserved, what we thought was the room with the balcony with great views. Despite several efforts via email to make sure we'd reserved the right room we were given another room upon check in. It also had a balcony which you accessed through a tall window/door but views were of the side of the taller building next door. The room was dark due to the lack of natural light. If it weren't for the tall ceilings, I would've felt pretty claustrophobic in there. We were disappointed but made the best of it and did still enjoy having some private outdoor space where we could relax.
reviews.title: Great location but room for improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedding had holes and really needs to be replaced along with the bed itself. There was a mini fridge in our room which was really handy and we didn't mind the stairs. The breakfast was okay but it would've been nice if they would vary the menu each day instead of the same thing day after day. The staff was quick to offer cappuccinos and they were absolutely wonderful.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the perfect location!

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of the positive reviews on this website and we were not disappointed. This is a delightful hotel. We stayed here with our three children in the family suite. The room (two adjoining) was great, airconditioned and location near piazza navone was unbeatable. Breakfasts were great. Yet, it was the Staff that really made this place fantastic. They were welcoming, (carried our luggage up the stairs), helpful in arranging cabs, tours and restaurants and and overall wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely return.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.text: Just come back from a week in Rome where we stayed at this fantastic hotel.
reviews.title: A great find in a perfect location

reviews.text: Like others have said - the location is amazing. Piazza Navona is metres away so no shortage of restaurants and people watching opportunities. We walked everywhere (with 10 & 11 yr old kids in tow) and used the hotel for popping back to as it was so convenient.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed stay at Residenza Canali
Lovely, perfectly-located little hotel
reviews.text: We had both rooms on the top floor with the fab terraces. Well worth the hike up the 89 steps (the kids counted!)

We just returned from our 2+week trip in Italy, and I have to take a moment to thank our hosts at Residenza Canali. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We traveled with our 3 kids 14,11,8 and were in the top room with the terrace. Although it was very HOT in Rome during our stay and we used the terrace only minimally, it was very nice in the late evenings to go out on it (particularly after exciting soccer wiins by Italia!!). Our room was cozy but quite frankly fit our family of 5 just fine. The airconditioning worked GREAT, the breakfasts were wonderful (each day's special pastry was my favorite) and the hosts were all very nice. In particular we enjoyed talking with the gentleman that worked evenings and was there to greet us upon our arrival day. Oh - and - as stated throughout Tripadvisor the location can not be beat. We would go back in a minute!
reviews.title: Noise can be a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had planned to stay 3 nights at Residenza Canali, but we messed up our reservation. Despite this, the staff were very helpful to fit us in and also organised us another hotel nearby for one night. We will be more careful next time since we definitely want to stay at Residenza Canali without interruption during our next visit to Rome.
reviews.title: Great central location, warm and welcoming team

reviews.text: Unlike so many other hotels in Rome, the windows and doors are well isolated, no draughts.
reviews.title: Its all about location! Location! Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ask the team for restaurant tips, which we thought were excellent and off the beaten track.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: Looking forward to coming back soon.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: Our family visited Rome for the first time last April of 2012 and after reading a lot of good reviews about Residenza Canali ai Coronari, we decided to book with them. We called them up and the reservation was a breeze! Was an easy ride to the hotel from the train station and there were a lot of cabs available. When we arrived at the hotel, we were definitely not disappointed! A charming hotel with character! We stayed on the 3rd floor (though we really wanted the room on the 4th floor with a rooftop terrace--unfortunately, it was booked already) and the room was perfect! Wooden floors with a lot of ample space. There were two double beds with a flat screen tv in one area which was near this huge and beautiful windows (though our view was another building which was too close to the hotel and the alley below us), huge closet which was across a dresser table with a small refrigerator beside it , a huge bathroom with a bath tub, hot water, blower, towels, and all those little toiletries. The best part were the wooden beams on the ceiling... Gorgeous! Pros: Best location ever! Very near Piazza Navona literally! Walking distance to a lot of good sites (bring comfortable shoes!) like the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, pantheon, etc. Great service and very helpful staff who happily helped us or advised us where to find good, authentic, & affordable Italian restaurants. They were also friendly enough to show us some good walking tours which we could do for ourselves. Breakfast was inclusive and they serve some good cappuccino. I love also the fresh breads but my fave would be the cake or desserts. Value for your money. Safe and secured locks on their main doors. Cons: Steep stairs (difficult if you're carrying a lot of luggage). Must try: Zio ciro restaurant but a better and affordable place to dine would be this italian resto just at the corner near zio ciro. Definitely will stay here again! Highly recommended !
reviews.title: Charming hotel with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Italy in early June of 2007 for our honeymoon and started our tip here. It was my first trip to Europe, but based on my extensive reading on what to expect, this hotel seems better than average.
reviews.title: Great location, smallish rooms

reviews.text: As most people state, this hotel has a great location. We walked to the ancient ruins (Colisseum, Forum, etc.) and the Spanish Steps; we took a bus to the Vatican (only because we were tired). The hotel is very close to Piazza Navona, but I would recommend eating at one of the small restaurants on a side street. Osteria del Pegno and Osteria del Aquino were both excellent.
reviews.title: Nice Old World Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: American travellers should be prepared for the small hotel rooms and the dearth of English-speaking channels on TV (only two). While the room may be small, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was bigger than expected.
reviews.title: Good Location in Rome

likes.disliked: — Lack of Quality AC (however during a heat wave)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Residenza Canali. It has an "old world" feel and is spectacularly located. Some hotels of this type feel run down and shabby, but RC is not. Our beds were comfy, the bathroom was adequate for 4 persons, there was both a fridge and safe in the room, and the much-needed A/C worked well. Their breakfast was the best of our trip with delicious dark coffee, bakery items, fruit, and meat every morning. The only shabby part of the place is the terrace. They could do a lot to spruce that area up, like clean it. But we did not use the terrace that much b/c of the heat and the mosquitos. Many, many good restaurants within easy walking distance and of course the Piazza Novona is just a stone's throw away so you can stroll in the evening with your gelato or go browse around for that "genuine" Prada handbag for 10 euros. They have no elevator and no computer to print out boarding passes. There is a handy taxi stand 1 block away. Lastly, they have a driver service to the airport which we used. I found him impatient and he does not have enough seat belts for 4 people despite me asking specifically about this issue before we booked. I would not use him again. He charges the same as a taxi (actually 5 euros more) and unless you need his big trunk for lots of luggage I just do not see any advantage. Plenty of taxis have adequate seat belts for 4. Since I do not know where else to post a review of tours I will say one thing abaout tours here. We booked a day trip to Pompeii with Context Rome that was spectacular. I highly recommend them. Additionally, we used RomeWalks for 2 tours in Rome, one at the Vatican, one at the Forum. RomeWalks was very middle of the road and I would probably not use them again.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this Hotel in Mid June. Rooms were clean, and comfortable. We had a terrace room and felt it was nice to sit outside at night and take in the Roman night. One observation that we made however was that during times of hot weather (really hot while we were there), the AC does not keep up with the outside temp and will not keep the room cool. At night our room was 80+ degrees F, which made it a little uncomfortable sleeping. While this was a minor problem, I think that during normal weather patterns, it probably is not an issue. Staff was very efficient and helpful.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, great location, great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is hidden away in a side street just off Piazza Navona. It is hard to find being in a pedestrianised area (in theory) and with only the description/sign a small card/name plate alongside the bell marking the front door.
reviews.title: Nice but not fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was pleasant but small with very limited storage space, two of us with weekend luggage was too much for the very small wardrobe with three coathangers and one shelf. We did have a problem with dirty bed linen from a previous guest but this was fixed swiftly by the staff when we complained. The bathroom was large and well decorated.
reviews.title: What a way to start a trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't hear any outside noise in the room but could hear adjoining bathrooms sufficiently that it woke us up everytime someone in a neighbouring room used the facilities, not ideal.
reviews.title: Lovely little place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was pleasant with everything we needed.
reviews.title: Tucked away but great access to Piazza Navona and ancient Rome

likes.liked: — The location and helpful, friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the hotel as a base exploring the local area and it was in an excellent location once you had found it. For the money we paid we expected more, I would go back but most probably try somewhere else first.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic! I found the hotel on this website (Trip Advisor) and based upon the reviews decided to book a 2-night stay for my family. We are a family of 5, so we booked the Junior Suite and it was excellent. We had two rooms and a nice bath. The rooms were very clean, set up perfectly for us and ready when we arrived.
reviews.title: Great Place - Excellent Location!!
Italy in November
reviews.text: We had the unfortunate luck of having no luggage when we arrived in Rome (lost in transit between Paris and Rome by the airlines), so we had to work with the desk clerks to be on alert for luggage deliveries from the airlines during our stay. They were fantastic to work with, very helpful and very attentive. Once our luggage arrived, they brought it up to our rooms and notified us immediately upon our return to the hotel from a day of siteseeing that the luggage had arrived.

reviews.title: Location Location Location
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good, fantastic coffee and lots of choices for the kids.

reviews.title: Excellent Location
reviews.text: The location is excellent. We were able to walk to Vatican City in ten minutes and to Piazza Navona in 2-3 minutes. There are a lot of cafes and gelato stops close by and some really neat little restaurants. I recommend enjoying a pizza or some pasta at one of the restaurants on the backside of Piazza Navona, as the prices are a bit lower than inside the Piazza itself.

We stayed here over New Years. The location is fantastic. It is in a very safe area and close to everything! Great restaurants, shopping, and tourist sites. We walked everywhere from this location. And...when you do need a cab, the taxi stand is less that a block away. The front desk staff are extremely knowledgeable and helpful. The room was very clean with comfy beds and nice linen. The bathroom shower was small and there is really no counter space for toilettries. The only drawbacks are the breakfast and the stairs. The breakfast was ample, but mediocre. Boxed cereal, yogurt, apples, oranges, croissants and buns, a small cold cut/cheese tray and a fancy tarte/cake that changed daily. Espresso. There is no outdoor terrace to eat at, unless you stay in one of the two junior suites on the fourth floor. The room is fine in the winter, but I would personally miss this a lot in the summer. I'm fine with stairs, but there is a flight up to the main floor and breakfast room, then there are more to floors 2, 3 and 4. There are 4 rooms on the second floor and 4 on the third. No elevators for luggage!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.text: This is a very delayed review. We stayed at Rezidenza Canali for 2 nights in August 2012 before taking a cruise. Our luggage got lost by airlines so we were very stressed as we were going to take a 7 day cruise. Stephan at the reception was very helpful and understanding calling the airlines multiple times for us. He was very helpful in even carried my daughters luggage up the stairs.Night staff I don't know his name did not speak English but was still very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent location, Great Staff

reviews.text: Excellent location. Walking distance to all the tourist spots.Loved staying in the heart of the city. Rooms were very tastefully decorated.Breakfast was excellent with Danish and pastries and excellent cappuccino ,we are all in love with Italian coffee. Will definitely be staying here when we visit Rome again and would definitely recommend it. Small boutique hotel tastefully decorated rooms, excellent location with a lot of great eating places, friendly staff.
reviews.title: A truly fantastic experience.

reviews.text: This hotel was the foundation for my fabulous time in Rome. The staff was very nice and helpful. I tend to be a more quiet person and keep to myself, but they were ready with an answer anytime I had a question. The room was beautiful, very clean, great connection (wifi), large (especially for Rome), with a terrace and a fabulous view. It's literally in the perfect location, on a cute side street off Piazza Navona. I felt very safe, which was important to me as I was traveling alone, and everything I went to was within a 30 minute walk at most. The area surrounding the hotel is full of charming shops and hole-in-the wall restaurants (which are always the best!). Breakfast was small, but good: Croissants, rolls, a fruit tart of some kind, meats, cheeses, cereal, yogurt, fruit, and jams. They will make you a cappuccino if you ask, and I highly suggest it; I thought it was delicious and better than any other I had in a cafe while there. This hotel is the absolute best when it comes to value and location. I would recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Rome.
reviews.title: Strongly recommended.
Nicely located in a quiet street off Piazza Navona
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights in this lovely hotel and we had a great time. The location was superb, our was clean and nice and was ready when we arrived early (11am). The room was furnished in a simple but stylish way. The service was helpful and men at reception were always friendly and willing to answer our questions. We also enjoyed breakfast and especially we liked the coffee. High quality for good price.

Myself, my husband and three teenage children have just returned from a 4 night break in Rome, staying at this wonderful hotel. The airport pick up, which was arranged via email direct with the hotel, was an efficient way to get into the city and delivered us right to the reception area of the hotel by the driver who helped with bags etc. The childrens room was spacious enough and our room on the top floor was lovely. It had a great roof terrace which was a lovely place to sit on an evening after a busy day. The rooms were clean and tastefully decorated and the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries and loads of towels. Breakfast was more than adequate with plenty of choice and everything was very fresh. Staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. All major sights in Rome are within walking distance of the hotel which made it the perfect location for us. It is right by the Piazza Navona so not far to walk for dinner on an evening! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a small family run hotel with lots of character in a central location.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: We would love to return to Rome and if we do we will be staying here again.
reviews.title: Good choice and great location

likes.liked: — The age of the building and the tucked-away locale

reviews.text: We were in Room 2 on the top floor. I specifically requested a room with a terrace and the only drawback to this room is that the A/C could not keep up with the extreme heat. I learned that the owner is planning on upgrading the A/C but until then be prepared to be very warm if you go in the summer. The terrace faces east so it is cooler and pleasant to sit on in the evening. Staff was extremely helpful and patient and their restaurant recommendations, especially the Trei Archi de Loretto, were excellent. I loved how the Residenza Canali is tucked away but yet so close to the Piazza Navona and an easy walk to the Pantheon and Vatican. The breakfast room has been relocated recently and is sunny and bright with a good choice of pastries and meats. I would happily return to this charming little inn on my next visit to Rome- which will NOT be in the summer!
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay

likes.liked: — Location, Location, Location. Tea making facilities - very unusual in Europe!
likes.disliked: — Terrace not available for us. Otherwise nothing.

reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay at this lovely little hotel/residence. We had two rooms side/side as we were a family of four. A twin and a double. The rooms were very nicely appointed. Bathrooms great although our shower a little small and not suitable for a larger person. Just make the request on booking. A/C was hotel wide so no adjustment - it was hot so fine by us. Staff were very friendly especially lovely Romanian/Bulgarian girl (sorry cant remember) who was so helpful, courteous, and charming. Offered to carry our bags down on departure. Breakfast good (our 12th diff accomm on this trip) with fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereal - good choice, and breads and pastries. Best of all was location. Dont stay anywhere else if you want to be in the midst (but in a quiet street) of plenty of restaurants and lively piazza (Navona). It was literally around the corner. Easy walk to Spanish Steps/Trevi/ Vatican even for lazy 18 y o daughter. Bus no. 87 around corner straight to Collosseum and back. Soooo easy. Unless you want 5 star with restaurant/bar (although why you would with so many restaurants/bars nearby) or lift/concierge service, dont stay anywhere else. We were very happy.
reviews.title: Location is excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Roof top room with terrace would have been perfect!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: we stayed 4 nights and loved this hotel. we droped our car at the Rome airport and took a taxi. It was a challenge for our taxi to find the place, we even asked several police and they had no idea. Finally, after locating the hotel on a quaint streel, Stephen, took our luggage up stairs. I had requested a room with a terrace for 3 persons. The climb (6 floors) was worth it. Great way to walk off all the calories consumed while traveling. The front desk was always helpful. Several times my daughter and I went shopping at 6 pm and instead of taking our bags to our room before dinner, we deposited them at the front desk to hold until we returned. I guess we were too lazy to walk the stairs. Great restaurants nearby, easy walk to the Vatican, Spanish Steps. We loved walking and exploring the wonderful small streets nearby. Nice breakfast, typical of european hotels. We did take advantage of their car service on our return trip home. 45 euros and I tipped him an extra 5. We would stay there again. Air conditioned and it works, well worth it after a hot day exploring Rome. We also paid cash to obtain the discount.
reviews.title: love this area

reviews.text: We stayed at the Residenza Canali again this year since we had such a positive experience there two years ago. Over all, I would have to say it was OK, but not outstanding. We were in room D. The shower was very small compared to the shower we had the first time we were there. You could hardly turn around in it. There was no bathtub. The mattress was very, and I do mean VERY hard. The people at the desk were very helpful and courteous. Breakfast was adequate. The location of the Residenza Canali is exceptional. Not a 4 star hotel, but it does not have 4 star prices either.
reviews.title: Second visit not as good as the first

reviews.text: Have just returned from a great weekend in Rome. The Residenza Canali was a perfect little place to stay - well-positioned, extremely friendly and helpful staff (esp. Stephan - thank you!), delicious breakfasts etc etc. Our room was delightful with a pretty roof terrace - perfect for a late-night glass of wine (a nice touch was the corkscrew and extra-large glasses for red wine!!) Its a very relaxing place to stay - a real oasis of calm in a very busy city. I would recommend the airport collection service - we used it both ways and it was well worth it! Many thanks to all at Residenza Canali - we'll be back!!
reviews.title: Delightful Roman Hide-away.

reviews.text: The hotel has a great location, nice breakfast. The entrance door is locked and you have to ring to be admitted, which is nice for security.
reviews.title: Great hotel, bad customer service
Special touches make all the difference
reviews.text: I was promised a double room for single use (and I had the email from the hotel staff with me) but I got stuck in a tiny single room. When I asked to be changed if a double was available they said I could change. I was there for one night and they rudely told me to return back to the single room and I mean very rudely. I won't go into all the aggravation they put me though, but it was not worth it and nearly ruined my trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a 4 night (Nov 15-19) stay at the Residenza Canali. One block from the Piazza Navona, this hotel was located 15 minutes from the Vatican, 15 minutes from the Colosseum (by bus) and in the heart of everything. The rooms were very clean and spacious -- yes spacious. The staff was very friendly. They offered great restaurant recommendations and were knowledgeable about much of the goings-on in Rome. I would return to this hotel again for another vacation.
reviews.title: What a GREAT find

likes.disliked: — Ask for a room with a terrace (#2)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just arrived from a 6 night stay at the Residenza Canali. This is our 6th holiday to Rome, but it was certainly the best, and a main reason for this was staying at this Jewel in the Heart of Rome.
reviews.title: A Rare Jewel

likes.liked: — The feeling of Old Rome in a quality accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know where to start...it's position is perfect, right in the centre of the Centro Storico, set on the most lovely and pedestrian street..Via Coronai. It was so quiet we just could not believe we were in Rome! The decor was done with such love for detail: polished wooden floors and ceilings, rooms and public areas furnished with antiques and rich curtains.The bed and cleanliness were excellent, with lovely brand new bathrooms with top notch fittings and towels and toiletries. The breakfast (buffet) was first -class, with cereals, various types of freshly baked bread, yoghurts, meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, real orange juice, and last but not least, the pastries! To die for! Everyday a different type of cake or torta with croissants and pastries just baked..hmmmmm! Beautiful breakfast room with lovely damask tablecloths, fresh flowers on each table. Tea and coffee making facilities in each room (top quality once again)
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service always with a smile and always ready to help.
reviews.title: absolutely wonderful
A true gentleman
reviews.text: I could go on but all I can say is go and see for yourself. You will feel you are really experiencing Antica Roma when staying in this exquisite jewel in the heart of Rome.

reviews.title: Perfect, or nearly so
reviews.text: We just returned from four nights at this charming hotel. We are a family with two children so we stayed in a two room suite. The rooms were well sized, very clean and beautifully remodelled. The beds were extremely comfortable. Be warned that you need to climb up the marble staircase, which could be important if mobility is a problem, but was no big deal for us. We were on the 2nd floor and I think there are at least four floors.

reviews.title: We'll Be Back!
reviews.text: The location is incredible! The hotel is on a tiny alley just off Via ai Coronari, a beautiful medieval street with shops, artisans and restaurants. It is around the corner to Piazza Navona and walking distance to everything we were interested in doing, which is important with young children. We could hear the sounds of people on Coronari if we had the windows open but very little if they were closed. Plus they were the happy sounds of people enjoying a beautiful part of Rome.
The staff was all wonderful! Very friendly and all spoke good enough English to be extremely helpful. A few had much better English than that.
reviews.title: Great location, nice staff but extremely noisy

reviews.text: Breakfasts were out of this world! A gorgeous buffet with meats and delicious bread and pastries were the main focus but there was also yogurt, cereal, orange juice, coffee and tea. It was good to have a substantial breakfast because then we could do something in the morning and take lunch as a break, instead of having everyone be hungry within an hour of leaving the hotel.
reviews.title: Simply wonderful!
A Kiss
reviews.text: One suggestion: Don't take for granted the prices on the website. I emailed them and discovered that (at least in the off season) they have a cash rate that saved a significant amount of money (145 vs. 185 euros per night).

aka: Residenza Canali Ai Coronari Hotel Rome
